intro: Hieracium murorum subsp. contreanum, commonly known as the creeping hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its low-growing habit with numerous flowering stems. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, typically blooming from June to August. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. It is considered an invasive species in some regions due to its rapid spread and competitive growth.
